summary_variants.short_answer: Geneva is a Swiss city on Lake Geneva known for diplomacy, humanitarian organizations, and finance.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Geneva is a city in Switzerland where many world helpers like the United Nations meet to solve problems.
summary_variants.standard: Geneva lies in western Switzerland near the French border and hosts numerous international organizations, including the United Nations Office at Geneva (UNOG), the World Health Organization, and the International Committee of the Red Cross. Its economy blends diplomacy, watchmaking, and private banking.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Mention CERN’s proximity, humanitarian law roots, and the city’s role in global governance frameworks.

slots.founded_or_incorporated: founded 1st century BCE (Allobrogian settlement); modern charter 1541
notable_features: International Committee of the Red Cross

sources.title: Ville de Genève - Faits et chiffres
